repnme.cdata!:
Afghanistan - Emergency Community
            Empowerment and Public Works Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcomes, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. A key lesson is, that in
            a difficult post-conflict situation characterized by limited
            government capacity, the project's choice of
            institutional arrangements featuring performance based
            contracting of service providers for implementation and
            management has lend itself to a rapid scaling up of both
            community-driven development (CDD), and labor intensive
            public works activities. A related lesson is that the
            establishment of such arrangements takes time, and
            expectations regarding how quickly operations can begin on
            the ground, need to be realistic. Furthermore, in a
            post-conflict context where rapid delivery of a "peace
            dividend" is critical to establish or maintain the
            credibility of government vis-à-vis the population,
            implementing agencies need to manage the challenge of
            maintaining engineering quality of sub-projects (as has been
            the issue in the community empowerment component), or of
            providing meaningful sub-projects (as has been the issue in
            the public works component, where villagers have questioned
            the usefulness of types of road repair that would only bring
            short-term benefits). Consultations with agencies that have
            prior experience of working in the local context is crucial
            for developing a sound implementation approach, and
            contributes at the same time to establish buy-in and
            commitment to key project principles. Other lessons address
            public works, institutional sustainability, and the
            introduction of innovative development approaches, and
            notably, Bank efficiency in delivery of assistance to weak
            client governments in post-conflict situations is critically
            dependent on having both operational and procurement,
            disbursement, and financial management staff on long-term
            assignments in the country office from the start of the
            operational presence.

            Empowerment and Public Works Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
Recognizing the emergency nature of the
            relief, and reconstruction operations, this Environmental
            and Social Safeguards Framework (ESSF) ensures the
            management of environmental adversity, provides guidance for
            social adverse impacts, and plans mitigation measures. It
            stipulates that no subprojects will be eligible should land
            acquisition affect 200 or more people, and, specifies
            attribute ineligibility of subprojects that involve
            significant degradation to natural habitats, cultural
            heritage sites, or forests (commercial logging is to be
            avoided), or, adversity to waters among riparian neighbors.
            Sectoral adversity is identified, followed by the relevant
            mitigation measures. 1) water supply infrastructure:
            prioritize leak detection; conduct chemical and
            bacteriological testing of water quality; install drainage
            pipes to prevent stagnant waters, and, covered pumps to
            prevent contamination; select sites for latrines and septic
            tanks installation; and, conduct regular surface, and
            groundwater investigations. 2) Solid waste: conduct frequent
            waste collections; minimize incineration practices;
            specifically identify collection, and disposal of medical,
            and hazardous wastes; establish appropriate monitoring
            criteria. 3) Roads: prepare adequate drainage designs;
            restore borrow areas; conduct re-vegetation practices to
            protect soil surfaces. 4) Erosion: maintain slope stability
            through re-vegetation; design and construct access roads;
            prevent firewood practices; remove, and adequately dispose
            of oil, bitumen, and hazardous material wastes. 5) Power:
            store waste transformer coolant air in sealed containers,
            pending safe disposal; and, preferably, the use of natural
            gas should be the choice. Measures in general, include
            health, and hygiene education, training, capacity building,
            and monitoring criteria to ensure the ESSF is appropriately implemented.

repnme.cdata!:
Afghanistan - Emergency Community
            Empowerment and Public Works Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Community Empowerment and
            Public Works Project aims at providing employment in rural
            areas at a minimum wage, as a safety net, to as many people,
            and in short a time as may be possible. Furthermore, the
            project will commence the process of helping villages
            rebuild their capital base through the provision of
            sub-grants, and empower villagers to plan for, and decide
            on, the investments to be made with the proceeds of the
            sub-grants. The grant will finance oversight consultants for
            both the labor-intensive works, and community grants;
            rehabilitation of provincial and district roads, and
            irrigation infrastructure; block grants to villages and
            neighborhoods; and, vehicles provision. Services will be
            provided to monitor the program, manage financial flows,
            record-keeping and audits, and, to carry out evaluation,
            institutional, impact, and follow-up studies. Needless to
            say, implementation difficulties due to conditions in the
            country are risks, that include security problems, lack of
            legal and regulatory systems, and, a weak and distorted
            market for skilled labor. However, project benefits - beyond
            labor opportunities - will far outnumber those risks.
